Home > external > kegg > getKEGGModelForOrganism.m

getKEGGModelForOrganism

PURPOSE

getKEGGModelForOrganism

SYNOPSIS

function model=getKEGGModelForOrganism(organismID,fastaFile,dataDir,outDir,keepSpontaneous,keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,keepGeneral,cutOff,minScoreRatioKO,minScoreRatioG,maxPhylDist,nSequences,seqIdentity)

DESCRIPTION 

 getKEGGModelForOrganism
   Reconstructs a genome-scale metabolic model based on protein homology
   to the orthologies in KEGG. If the target species is not available in
   KEGG, the user must select a closely related species. It is also
   possible to circumvent protein homology search (see fastaFile parameter
   for more details)

   Input:
   organismID          three or four letter abbreviation of the organism
                       (as used in KEGG). If not available, use a closely
                       related species. This is used for determing the
                       phylogenetic distance. Use 'eukaryotes' or
                       'prokaryotes' to get a model for the whole domain.
                       Only applicable if fastaFile is empty, i.e. no
                       homology search should be performed
   fastaFile           a FASTA file that contains the protein sequences of
                       the organism for which to reconstruct a model (opt,
                       if no FASTA file is supplied then a model is
                       reconstructed based only on the organism
                       abbreviation. This option ignores all settings
                       except for keepSpontaneous, keepUndefinedStoich,
                       keepIncomplete and keepGeneral)
   dataDir             directory for which to retrieve the input data.
                       Should contain a combination of these sub-folders:
                       -dataDir\keggdb
                           The KEGG database files used in 1a (see below)
                       -dataDir\fasta
                           The multi-FASTA files generated in 1b (see
                           below)
                       -dataDir\aligned
                           The aligned FASTA files as generated in 2a (see
                           below)
                       -dataDir\hmms
                           The hidden Markov models as generated in 2b or
                           downloaded from BioMet Toolbox (see below)
                       The final directory in dataDir should be styled as
                       proXXX_keggYY or eukXXX_keggYY, indicating whether
                       the HMMs were trained on pro- or eukaryotic
                       sequences, using a sequence similarity threshold of
                       XXX %, fitting the KEGG version YY. E.g.
                       euk100_kegg82. (opt, see note about fastaFile. Note
                       that in order to rebuild the KEGG model from a
                       database dump, as opposed to using the version
                       supplied with RAVEN, you would still need to supply
                       this)
   outDir              directory to save the results from the quering of
                       the hidden Markov models. The output is specific
                       for the input sequences and the settings used. It
                       is stored in this manner so that the function can
                       continue if interrupted or if it should run in
                       parallel. Be careful not to leave output files from
                       different organisms or runs with different settings
                       in the same folder. They will not be overwritten
                       (opt, default is a temporary dir where all *.out
                       files are deleted before and after doing the
                       reconstruction)
   keepSpontaneous     include reactions labeled as "spontaneous". (opt,
                       default true)
   keepUndefinedStoich    include reactions in the form n A <=> n+1 A. These
                       will be dealt with as two separate metabolites
                       (opt, default true)
   keepIncomplete      include reactions which have been labelled as
                       "incomplete", "erroneous" or "unclear" (opt,
                       default true)
   keepGeneral         include reactions which have been labelled as
                       "general reaction". These are reactions on the form
                       "an aldehyde <=> an alcohol", and are therefore
                       unsuited for modelling purposes. Note that not all
                       reactions have this type of annotation, and the
                       script will therefore not be able to remove all
                       such reactions (opt, default false)
   cutOff              significance score from HMMer needed to assign
                       genes to a KO (opt, default 10^-50)
   minScoreRatioG      a gene is only assigned to KOs for which the score
                       is >=log(score)/log(best score) for that gene. This
                       is to prevent that a gene which clearly belongs to
                       one KO is assigned also to KOs with much lower
                       scores (opt, default 0.8 (lower is less strict))
   minScoreRatioKO     ignore genes in a KO if their score is
                       <log(score)/log(best score in KO). This is to
                       "prune" KOs which have many genes and where some are
                       clearly a better fit (opt, default 0.3 (lower is
                       less strict))
   maxPhylDist         -1: only use sequences from the same domain
                       (Prokaryota, Eukaryota)
                       other (positive) value: only use sequences for
                       organisms where the phylogenetic distance is at the
                       most this large (as calculated in getPhylDist)
                       (opt, default Inf, which means that all sequences
                       will be used)
   nSequences          for each KO, use up to this many sequences from the
                       most closely related species. This is mainly to
                       speed up the alignment process for KOs with very
                       many genes. This subsampling is performed before
                       running CD-HIT (opt, default inf)
   seqIdentity         sequence identity threshold in CD-HIT, referred as
                       "global sequence identity" in CD-HIT User's Guide.
                       The only possible options are 1 (100 %), 0.9 (90 %)
                       and 0.5 (50 %). If other values are provided,
                       CD-HIT is skipped (opt, default -1, i.e. CD-HIT is
                       skipped)

   Output:
   model               the reconstructed model

   PLEASE READ THIS: The input to this function can be confusing, because
   it is intended to be run in parallel on a cluster or in multiple
   sessions. It therefore saves a lot of intermediate results to storage.
   This also serves the purpose of not having to do redundant
   calculations. This, however, comes with the disadvantage of somewhat
   trickier handling. This is what this function does:

   1a. Loads files from a local KEGG FTP dump and constructs a general
       RAVEN model representing the metabolic network. The functions
       getRxnsFromKEGG, getGenesFromKEGG, getMetsFromKEGG summarise the
       data into 'keggRxns.mat', 'keggGenes.mat' and 'keggMets.mat' files,
       which are later merged into 'keggModel.mat' by getModelFromKEGG
       function. The function getPhylDist generates 'keggPhylDist.mat'
       file. KEGG FTP access requires a <a href="matlab:
       web('http://www.bioinformatics.jp/en/keggftp.html')">license</a>.
   1b. Generates protein FASTA files from the KEGG FTP dump (see 1a). One
       multi-FASTA file for each KO in KEGG is generated.

   The Step 1 has to be re-done every time KEGG updates their database (or
   rather when the updates are large enough to warrant re-running this
   part). Many users would probably never use this feature.

   2a. Filters KO-specific protein sets. This is done by using the
       settings "maxPhylDist" and "nSequences" to control which sequences
       should be used for constructing Hidden Markov models (HMMs), and
       later for matching your sequences to.
       The most common alternatives here would be to use sequences from
       only eukaryotes, only prokaryotes or all sequences in KEGG. As
       explained in the README.md file, various sets of pre-trained hidden
       Markov models are available at <a href="matlab:
       web('http://biomet-toolbox.chalmers.se/index.php?page=downtools-raven')">BioMet
       Toolbox</a>. This is normally the most convenient way, but if you
       would like to use, for example, only fungal sequences for training
       the HMMs then you need to re-run this step.
   2b. KO-specific protein FASTA files are re-organised into
       non-redundant protein sets with CD-HIT. The user can only set
       seqIdentity parameter, which corresponds to '-c' parameter in
       CD-HIT, described as "sequence identity threshold". The following
       non-default parameter settings are used depending on seqIdentity
       value:
       __________________________________________________________________
       |                           |         seqIdentity value          |
       |                           --------------------------------------
       |                           |  1.0   |  0.9   |  0.5   |    x    |
       | CD-HIT parameters         -------------------------------------|
       -----------------------------------------------------------------|
       | Input Dataset (-i)        | raw    | cdh100 | cdh90  | raw     |
       | Output Dataset (-o)       | cdh100 | cdh90  | cdh50  | cdhOth  |
       | Sequence identity (-c)    | 1.0    | 0.9    | 0.5    | x       |
       | word_length (-n)          | 5      | 5      | 4      | 2-5*    |
       | Max available memory (-M) |               2000                 |
       ------------------------------------------------------------------        
       * - word length depends from sequence identity value (see CD-HIT
       manual for more details)

       The table reads as follows: if seqIdentity is equal to 1, then
       "cdh100" set is produced from raw set of proteins. If seqIdentity
       is equal to 0.9, then "cdh90" is produced from "cdh100" proteins
       set. When seqIdentity is equal to 0.5, "cdh50" is obtained from
       "cdh90" protein set. Finally, if other seqIdentity value is used,
       it is obtained directly from the raw set of proteins.
   2c. Does a multi sequence alignment for multi-FASTA files obtained in
       Step 2b for future use. MAFFT software with automatic selection of
       alignment algorithm is used in this step ('--auto').
   2d. Trains hidden Markov models using HMMer for each of the aligned
       KO-specific FASTA files obtained in Step 2c. This is performed with
       'hmmbuild' using the default settings.

   Step 2 may be reasonable to be re-done if the user wants to tweak the
   settings in proteins filtering, clustering, multi sequence alignment or
   HMMs training steps. However, it requires to have KO-specific protein
   FASTA files obtained in Step 1a. As such files are not provided in
   RAVEN and BioMet ToolBox, the user can only generate these files from
   KEGG FTP dump files, so KEGG FTP license is needed.

   3a. Queries the HMMs with sequences for the organism you are making a
       model for. This step uses both the output from step 1a and from 2d.
       This is done with 'hmmsearch' function under default settings. The
       significance threshold value set in 'cutOff' parameter is used
       later when parsing '*.out' files to filter out KO hits with higher
       value than 'cutOff' value. The results with passable E values are
       summarised into KO-gene occurence matrix with E values in
       intersections as 'koGeneMat'. The parameters 'minScoreRatioG' and
       'minScoreRatioKO' are then applied to 'prune' KO-gene associations
       (see the function descriptions above for more details). The
       intersection values for these 'prunable' associations are converted
       to zeroes.
   3b. Constructs a model based on the pre-processed KO-gene association
       matrix (koGeneMat). As the full KEGG model already has reaction-KO
       relationships, KOs are converted into the query genes. The final
       draft model contains only these reactions, which are associated
       with KOs from koGeneMat. The reactions without the genes may also
       be included, if the user set keepSpontaneous as 'true'.

   The Step 3 is specific to the organism for which the model is
   reconstructed.

   In principle the function looks at which output that is already available
   and runs only the parts that are required for step 3. This means
   that (see the definition of the parameters for details):
   -1a is only performed if there are no KEGG model files in the
   RAVEN\external\kegg directory
   -1b is only performed if not all required HMMs OR aligned FASTA files
   OR multi-FASTA files exist in the defined dataDir. This means that this
   step is skipped if the HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead
   (see above). If not all files exist it will try to find
   the KEGG database files in dataDir.
   -2a is only performed if not all required HMMs OR aligned FASTA files
   files exist in the defined dataDir. This means that this step is skipped
   if the HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see above).
   -2b is only performed if not all required HMMs exist in the defined
   dataDir. This means that this step is skipped if the FASTA files or
   HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see above).
   -3a is performed for the required HMMs for which no corresponding .out
   file exists in outDir. This is just a way to enable the function to be
   run in parallel or to resume if interrupted.
   -3b is always performed.

   These steps are specific to the organism for which you are
   reconstructing the model.

   Regarding the whole pipeline, the function checks the output that is
   already available and runs only the parts that are required for step 3.
   This means that (see the definition of the parameters for details):
   -1a is only performed if there are no KEGG model files in the
   RAVEN\external\kegg directory.
   -1b is only performed if any of required KOs do not have HMMs, aligned
   FASTA files, clustered FASTA files and raw FASTA files in the defined
   dataDir. This means that this step is skipped if the HMMs are
   downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see above). If not all files
   exist it will try to find the KEGG database files in dataDir.
   -2ab are only performed if any of required KOs do not have HMMs,
   aligned FASTA files and clustered FASTA files in the defined dataDir.
   This means that this step is skipped if the HMMs are downloaded from
   BioMet Toolbox instead (see above).
   -2c is only performed if any of required KOs do not have HMMs and
   aligned FASTA files in the defined dataDir. This means that this step
   is skipped if the HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see
   above).
   -2d is only performed if any of required KOs do not have HMMs exist in
   the defined dataDir. This means that this step is skipped if the FASTA
   files or HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see above).
   -3a is performed for the required HMMs for which no corresponding .out
   file exists in outDir. This is just a way to enable the function to be
   run in parallel or to resume if interrupted.
   -3b is always performed.

   NOTE: it is also possible to obtain draft model from KEGG without
   providing protein FASTA file for the target organism. In such case the
   organism three-four letter abbreviation set as 'organismID' must exist
   in the local KEGG database. In such case, the program just fetches all
   the reactions, which are associated with given 'organismID'.

   Usage: model=getKEGGModelForOrganism(organismID,fastaFile,dataDir,...
    outDir,keepSpontaneous,keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,...
    keepGeneral,cutOff,minScoreRatioKO,minScoreRatioG,maxPhylDist,...
    nSequences,seqIdentity)

   Simonas Marcisauskas, 2019-01-14

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
  • getModelFromKEGG getModelFromKEGG
  • getPhylDist getPhylDist
This function is called by:

SUBFUNCTIONS

  • function files=listFiles(directory)

0224 %   file exists in outDir. This is just a way to enable the function to be
0225 %   run in parallel or to resume if interrupted.
0226 %   -3b is always performed.
0227 %
0228 %   These steps are specific to the organism for which you are
0229 %   reconstructing the model.
0230 %
0231 %   Regarding the whole pipeline, the function checks the output that is
0232 %   already available and runs only the parts that are required for step 3.
0233 %   This means that (see the definition of the parameters for details):
0234 %   -1a is only performed if there are no KEGG model files in the
0235 %   RAVEN\external\kegg directory.
0236 %   -1b is only performed if any of required KOs do not have HMMs, aligned
0237 %   FASTA files, clustered FASTA files and raw FASTA files in the defined
0238 %   dataDir. This means that this step is skipped if the HMMs are
0239 %   downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see above). If not all files
0240 %   exist it will try to find the KEGG database files in dataDir.
0241 %   -2ab are only performed if any of required KOs do not have HMMs,
0242 %   aligned FASTA files and clustered FASTA files in the defined dataDir.
0243 %   This means that this step is skipped if the HMMs are downloaded from
0244 %   BioMet Toolbox instead (see above).
0245 %   -2c is only performed if any of required KOs do not have HMMs and
0246 %   aligned FASTA files in the defined dataDir. This means that this step
0247 %   is skipped if the HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see
0248 %   above).
0249 %   -2d is only performed if any of required KOs do not have HMMs exist in
0250 %   the defined dataDir. This means that this step is skipped if the FASTA
0251 %   files or HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see above).
0252 %   -3a is performed for the required HMMs for which no corresponding .out
0253 %   file exists in outDir. This is just a way to enable the function to be
0254 %   run in parallel or to resume if interrupted.
0255 %   -3b is always performed.
0256 %
0257 %   NOTE: it is also possible to obtain draft model from KEGG without
0258 %   providing protein FASTA file for the target organism. In such case the
0259 %   organism three-four letter abbreviation set as 'organismID' must exist
0260 %   in the local KEGG database. In such case, the program just fetches all
0261 %   the reactions, which are associated with given 'organismID'.
0262 %
0263 %   Usage: model=getKEGGModelForOrganism(organismID,fastaFile,dataDir,...
0264 %    outDir,keepSpontaneous,keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,...
0265 %    keepGeneral,cutOff,minScoreRatioKO,minScoreRatioG,maxPhylDist,...
0266 %    nSequences,seqIdentity)
0267 %
0268 %   Simonas Marcisauskas, 2019-01-14
0269 
0270 if nargin<2
0271     fastaFile=[];
0272 end
0273 if nargin<3
0274     dataDir=[];
0275 end
0276 if nargin<4
0277     outDir=[];
0278 end
0279 if isempty(outDir)
0280     outDir=tempdir;
0281     %Delete all *.out files if any exist
0282     delete(fullfile(outDir,'*.out'));
0283 elseif ~isstr(outDir)
0284     error('outDir should be provided as string');
0285 end
0286 if nargin<5
0287     keepSpontaneous=true;
0288 end
0289 if nargin<6
0290     keepUndefinedStoich=true;
0291 end
0292 if nargin<7
0293     keepIncomplete=true;
0294 end
0295 if nargin<8
0296     keepGeneral=false;
0297 end
0298 if nargin<9
0299     cutOff=10^-50;
0300 end
0301 if nargin<10
0302     minScoreRatioKO=0.3;
0303 end
0304 if nargin<11
0305     minScoreRatioG=0.8;
0306 end
0307 if nargin<12
0308     maxPhylDist=inf;
0309     %Include all sequences for each reaction
0310 end
0311 if nargin<13
0312     nSequences=inf;
0313     %Include all sequences for each reaction
0314 end
0315 if nargin<14
0316     seqIdentity=-1;
0317     %CD-HIT is not used in the pipeline
0318 end
0319 
0320 %Check that FASTA file exists
0321 if ~isempty(fastaFile)
0322     if ~isstr(fastaFile)
0323         error('FASTA file should be provided as string');
0324     end
0325     if ~(exist(fastaFile,'file')==2)
0326         error('FASTA file %s cannot be found',string(fastaFile));
0327     end
0328 end
0329 %Run the external binaries multi-threaded to use all logical cores assigned
0330 %to MATLAB
0331 cores = evalc('feature(''numcores'')');
0332 cores = strsplit(cores, 'MATLAB was assigned: ');
0333 cores = regexp(cores{2},'^\d*','match');
0334 cores = cores{1};
0335 
0336 %Get the directory for RAVEN Toolbox. This is to get the path to the third
0337 %party software used
0338 [ST, I]=dbstack('-completenames');
0339 ravenPath=fileparts(fileparts(fileparts(ST(I).file)));
0340 
0341 %Checking if dataDir is consistent. It must point to pre-trained HMMs set,
0342 %compatible with the the current RAVEN version. The user may have the
0343 %required zip file already in working directory or have it extracted. If
0344 %the zip file and directory is not here, it is downloaded from the cloud
0345 if ~isempty(dataDir)
0346     hmmOptions={'euk100_kegg87', ...
0347         'euk90_kegg87', ...
0348         'euk50_kegg87', ...
0349         'prok100_kegg87', ...
0350         'prok90_kegg87', ...
0351         'prok50_kegg87'};
0352     hmmLinks={'13x9tuuux0gkni0grw6fnhjdtziva4tp', ...
0353         'gv8boei9nrt5s1od7da0nrtqx18a1k3f', ...
0354         'f27ofcyu7s7xw1ftjrn864w3c0vgnksa', ...
0355         'u8c7ljqnzzii7oxg6g36lp7cgtgwu4ci', ...
0356         'u3z7s31q5be4zqpmmsxgvfb0ye1x2lez', ...
0357         'rsug46hptvoy7hurooi6fsc1hz2f5b6v'};
0358     if all(cellfun(@isempty,regexp(dataDir,strcat(hmmOptions,'$')))) %Check if dataDir ends with any of the hmmOptions
0359         if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb','genes.pep'),'file') && ...
0360                 ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta'),'dir') && ...
0361                 ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned'),'dir') && ...
0362                 ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms'),'dir')
0363             EM='Pre-trained HMMs set is not recognised. It should match any of the following sets (which are available to download):';
0364             disp(EM);
0365             disp(hmmOptions);
0366             error('Fatal error occured. See the details above');
0367         end
0368     else
0369         if exist(dataDir,'dir')
0370             fprintf('Provided dataDir is in correct format for this RAVEN version in order to use pre-trained HMMs...\n')
0371         elseif ~exist(dataDir,'dir') && exist([dataDir,'.zip'],'file')
0372             fprintf('Extracting HMMs archive file...\n');
0373             unzip([dataDir,'.zip']);
0374         else
0375             hmmIndex=regexp(dataDir,hmmOptions);
0376             hmmIndex=~cellfun(@isempty,hmmIndex);
0377             fprintf('Downloading HMMs archive file...\n');
0378             websave([dataDir,'.zip'],['https://chalmersuniversity.box.com/shared/static/',hmmLinks{hmmIndex},'.zip']);
0379             fprintf('Extracting HMMs archive file...\n');
0380             unzip([dataDir,'.zip']);
0381         end
0382         %Check if HMMs are extracted
0383         if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms','K00844.hmm'),'file')
0384             EM=['The HMM files seem improperly extracted and not found in ',dataDir,'/hmms. Please remove ',dataDir,' folder and rerun getKEGGModelForOrganism'];
0385             disp(EM);
0386             error('Fatal error occured. See the details above');
0387         end
0388     end
0389 end
0390 
0391 %Check if the fasta-file contains '/' or'\'. If not then it's probably just
0392 %a file name. Expand to full path.
0393 if any(fastaFile)
0394     if ~any(strfind(fastaFile,'\')) && ~any(strfind(fastaFile,'/'))
0395         fastaFile=which(fastaFile);
0396     end
0397     %Create the required sub-folders in dataDir if they dont exist
0398     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb'),'dir')
0399         mkdir(dataDir,'keggdb');
0400     end
0401     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta'),'dir')
0402         mkdir(dataDir,'fasta');
0403     end
0404     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned'),'dir')
0405         mkdir(dataDir,'aligned');
0406     end
0407     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms'),'dir')
0408         mkdir(dataDir,'hmms');
0409     end
0410     if ~exist(outDir,'dir')
0411         mkdir(outDir);
0412     end
0413 end
0414 
0415 %First generate the full KEGG model. The dataDir mustn't be supplied as
0416 %there is also an internal RAVEN version available
0417 if any(dataDir)
0418     [model, KOModel]=getModelFromKEGG(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb'),keepSpontaneous,keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,keepGeneral);
0419 else
0420     [model, KOModel]=getModelFromKEGG([],keepSpontaneous,keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,keepGeneral);
0421 end
0422 fprintf('Completed generation of KEGG model\n');
0423 model.id=organismID;
0424 model.c=zeros(numel(model.rxns),1);
0425 
0426 %If no FASTA file is supplied, then just remove all genes which are not for
0427 %the given organism ID
0428 if isempty(fastaFile)
0429     if ismember(organismID,{'eukaryotes','prokaryotes'})
0430         phylDists=getPhylDist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb'),maxPhylDist==-1);
0431         if strcmp(organismID,'eukaryotes')
0432             proxyid='hsa';
0433             %Use H. sapiens here
0434         else
0435             proxyid='eco';
0436             %Use E. coli here
0437         end
0438         [~, phylDistId]=ismember(proxyid,phylDists.ids);
0439         idsToKeep=phylDists.ids(~isinf(phylDists.distMat(phylDistId,:)));
0440         taxIDs=cellfun(@(x) x{1},cellfun(@(x) strsplit(x,':'),model.genes,'UniformOutput',false),'UniformOutput',false);
0441         I=ismember(upper(taxIDs),upper(idsToKeep));
0442     else
0443         %KEGG organism IDs may have three or four letters
0444         organismID=strcat(organismID,':');
0445         %Add colon for accurate matching
0446         if length(organismID)==4
0447             I=cellfun(@(x) strcmpi(x(1:4),organismID),model.genes);
0448         elseif length(organismID)==5
0449             I=cellfun(@(x) strcmpi(x(1:5),organismID),model.genes);
0450         end
0451     end
0452     %Remove those genes
0453     model.genes=model.genes(I);
0454     model.rxnGeneMat=model.rxnGeneMat(:,I);
0455 end
0456 
0457 %First remove all reactions without genes
0458 if keepSpontaneous==true
0459     load(fullfile(ravenPath,'external','kegg','keggRxns.mat'),'isSpontaneous');
0460     I=~any(model.rxnGeneMat,2)&~ismember(model.rxns,isSpontaneous);
0461     spontRxnsWithGenes=model.rxns(any(model.rxnGeneMat,2)&~ismember(model.rxns,isSpontaneous));
0462 else
0463     I=~any(model.rxnGeneMat,2);
0464 end
0465 model=removeReactions(model,I,true);
0466 
0467 %Clean gene names
0468 for i=1:numel(model.genes)
0469     %First get rid of the prefix organism id
0470     model.genes{i}=model.genes{i}(strfind(model.genes{i},':')+1:end);
0471     %Find and remove the description in parentheses if any
0472     s=strfind(model.genes{i},'(');
0473     if any(s)
0474         model.genes{i}=model.genes{i}(1:s-1);
0475     end
0476 end
0477 
0478 %If no FASTA file is supplied, then we're done here
0479 if isempty(fastaFile)
0480     %Create grRules
0481     model.grRules=cell(numel(model.rxns),1);
0482     model.grRules(:)={''};
0483     %Add the gene associations as 'or'
0484     for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
0485         %Find the involved genes
0486         I=find(model.rxnGeneMat(i,:));
0487         if any(I)
0488             model.grRules{i}=['(' model.genes{I(1)}];
0489             for j=2:numel(I)
0490                 model.grRules{i}=[model.grRules{i} ' or ' model.genes{I(j)}];
0491             end
0492             model.grRules{i}=[model.grRules{i} ')'];
0493         end
0494     end
0495     %Fix grRules and reconstruct rxnGeneMat
0496     [grRules,rxnGeneMat] = standardizeGrRules(model); %Give detailed output
0497     model.grRules = grRules;
0498     model.rxnGeneMat = rxnGeneMat;
0499     %Add geneMiriams, assuming that it follows the syntax
0500     %kegg.genes/organismID:geneName
0501     model.geneMiriams='';
0502     for i=1:numel(model.genes)
0503         model.geneMiriams{i,1}.name{1,1}='kegg.genes';
0504         model.geneMiriams{i,1}.value{1,1}=strcat(lower(organismID),model.genes{i,1});
0505     end
0506     %Add the description to the reactions
0507     for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
0508         if ~isempty(model.rxnNotes{i})
0509             model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat('Included by getKEGGModelFromOrganism (without HMMs).',model.rxnNotes(i));
0510             model.rxnNotes(i)=strrep(model.rxnNotes(i),'.','. ');
0511         else
0512             model.rxnNotes(i)={'Included by getKEGGModelFromOrganism (without HMMs)'};
0513         end
0514     end
0515     return;
0516 end
0517 
0518 %Create a phylogenetic distance structure
0519 phylDistStruct=getPhylDist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb'),maxPhylDist==-1);
0520 [~, phylDistId]=ismember(model.id,phylDistStruct.ids);
0521 fprintf('Completed creation of phylogenetic distance matrix\n');
0522 
0523 %Calculate the real maximal distance now. An abitary large number of 1000
0524 %is used for the "all in kingdom" or "all sequences" options. This is a bit
0525 %inconvenient way to do it, but it's to make it fit with some older code
0526 if isinf(maxPhylDist) || maxPhylDist==-1
0527     maxPhylDist=1000;
0528 end
0529 
0530 %Get the KO ids for which files have been generated. Maybe not the neatest
0531 %way..
0532 fastaFiles=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta','*.fa'));
0533 alignedFiles=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned','*.fa'));
0534 alignedWorking=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned','*.faw'));
0535 hmmFiles=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms','*.hmm'));
0536 outFiles=listFiles(fullfile(outDir,'*.out'));
0537 
0538 %Check if multi-FASTA files should be generated. This should only be
0539 %performed if there are IDs in the KOModel structure that haven't been
0540 %parsed yet
0541 missingFASTA=setdiff(KOModel.rxns,[fastaFiles;alignedFiles;hmmFiles;outFiles]);
0542 
0543 if ~isempty(missingFASTA)
0544     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb','genes.pep'),'file')
0545         EM=['The file ''genes.pep'' cannot be located at ' strrep(dataDir,'\','/') '/ and should be downloaded from the KEGG FTP.\n'];
0546         dispEM(EM);
0547     end
0548     %Only construct models for KOs which don't have files already
0549     fastaModel=removeReactions(KOModel,setdiff(KOModel.rxns,missingFASTA),true,true);
0550     %Permute the order of the KOs in the model so that constructMultiFasta
0551     %can be run on several processors at once
0552     fastaModel=permuteModel(fastaModel,randperm(RandStream.create('mrg32k3a','Seed',cputime()),numel(fastaModel.rxns)),'rxns');
0553     constructMultiFasta(fastaModel,fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb','genes.pep'),fullfile(dataDir,'fasta'));
0554 end
0555 fprintf('Completed generation of multi-FASTA files\n');
0556 
0557 if isunix
0558     if ismac
0559         binEnd='.mac';
0560     else
0561         binEnd='';
0562     end
0563 elseif ispc
0564     binEnd='';
0565 else
0566     EM='Unknown OS, exiting.';
0567     disp(EM);
0568     return
0569 end
0570 
0571 %Check if alignment of FASTA files should be performed
0572 missingAligned=setdiff(KOModel.rxns,[alignedFiles;hmmFiles;alignedWorking;outFiles]);
0573 if ~isempty(missingAligned)
0574     missingAligned=missingAligned(randperm(RandStream.create('mrg32k3a','Seed',cputime()),numel(missingAligned)));
0575     %Align all sequences using MAFFT
0576     for i=1:numel(missingAligned)
0577         %This is checked here because it could be that it is created by a
0578         %parallel process. The faw-files are saved as temporary files to
0579         %kept track of which files are being worked on
0580         if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),'file') &&...
0581                 ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']),'file')
0582             %Check that the multi-FASTA file exists. It should do so since
0583             %we are saving empty files as well. Print a warning and
0584             %continue if not
0585             if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']),'file')
0586                 EM=['WARNING: The multi-FASTA file for ' missingAligned{i} ' does not exist'];
0587                 dispEM(EM,false);
0588                 continue;
0589             end
0590             
0591             %If the multi-FASTA file is empty then save an empty aligned
0592             %file and continue
0593             s=dir(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']));
0594             if s.bytes<=0
0595                 fid=fopen(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']),'w');
0596                 fclose(fid);
0597                 continue;
0598             end
0599             
0600             %Create an empty file to prevent other threads to start to work
0601             %on the same alignment
0602             fid=fopen(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),'w');
0603             fclose(fid);
0604             
0605             %First load the FASTA file, then select up to nSequences
0606             %sequences of the most closely related species, apply any
0607             %constraints from maxPhylDist, and save it as a temporary file,
0608             %and create the model from that
0609             
0610             fastaStruct=fastaread(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']));
0611             phylDist=inf(numel(fastaStruct),1);
0612             for j=1:numel(fastaStruct)
0613                 %Get the organism abbreviation
0614                 index=strfind(fastaStruct(j).Header,':');
0615                 if any(index)
0616                     abbrev=fastaStruct(j).Header(1:index(1)-1);
0617                     [~, index]=ismember(abbrev,phylDistStruct.ids);
0618                     if any(index)
0619                         phylDist(j)=phylDistStruct.distMat(index(1),phylDistId);
0620                     end
0621                 end
0622             end
0623             
0624             %Inf means that it should not be included
0625             phylDist(phylDist>maxPhylDist)=[];
0626             
0627             %Sort based on phylDist
0628             [~, order]=sort(phylDist);
0629             
0630             %Save the first nSequences hits to a temporary FASTA file
0631             if nSequences<=numel(fastaStruct)
0632                 fastaStruct=fastaStruct(order(1:nSequences));
0633             else
0634                 fastaStruct=fastaStruct(order);
0635             end
0636             
0637             %Do the clustering and alignment if there are more than one
0638             %sequences, otherwise just save the sequence (or an empty file)
0639             if numel(fastaStruct)>1
0640                 if ~ispc
0641                     if seqIdentity==0.9
0642                         cdhitInp100=tempname;
0643                         fastawrite(cdhitInp100,fastaStruct);
0644                         cdhitInp90=tempname;
0645                         [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInp100 '" -o "' cdhitInp90 '" -c 1.0 -n 5 -M 2000']);
0646                         if status~=0
0647                             EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0648                             dispEM(EM);
0649                         end
0650                         %Remove the old tempfile
0651                         if exist(cdhitInp100, 'file')
0652                             delete([cdhitInp100 '*']);
0653                         end
0654                         tmpFile=tempname;
0655                         [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInp90 '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c 0.9 -n 5 -M 2000 -aL 0.8']);
0656                         if status~=0
0657                             EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0658                             dispEM(EM);
0659                         end
0660                         %Remove the old tempfile
0661                         if exist(cdhitInp90, 'file')
0662                             delete([cdhitInp90 '*']);
0663                         end
0664                     elseif seqIdentity==0.5
0665                         cdhitInp100=tempname;
0666                         fastawrite(cdhitInp100,fastaStruct);
0667                         cdhitInp90=tempname;
0668                         [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInp100 '" -o "' cdhitInp90 '" -c 1.0 -n 5 -M 2000']);
0669                         if status~=0
0670                             EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0671                             dispEM(EM);
0672                         end
0673                         %Remove the old tempfile
0674                         if exist(cdhitInp100, 'file')
0675                             delete([cdhitInp100 '*']);
0676                         end
0677                         cdhitInp50=tempname;
0678                         [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInp90 '" -o "' cdhitInp50 '" -c 0.9 -n 5 -M 2000 -aL 0.8']);
0679                         if status~=0
0680                             EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0681                             dispEM(EM);
0682                         end
0683                         %Remove the old tempfile
0684                         if exist(cdhitInp90, 'file')
0685                             delete([cdhitInp90 '*']);
0686                         end
0687                         tmpFile=tempname;
0688                         [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInp50 '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c 0.5 -n 3 -M 2000 -aL 0.8']);
0689                         if status~=0
0690                             EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0691                             dispEM(EM);
0692                         end
0693                         %Remove the old tempfile
0694                         if exist(cdhitInp50, 'file')
0695                             delete([cdhitInp50 '*']);
0696                         end
0697                     elseif seqIdentity~=-1
0698                         cdhitInpCustom=tempname;
0699                         fastawrite(cdhitInpCustom,fastaStruct);
0700                         tmpFile=tempname;
0701                         if seqIdentity<=1 && seqIdentity>0.7
0702                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInpCustom '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c "' num2str(seqIdentity) '" -n 5 -M 2000']);
0703                         elseif seqIdentity>0.6
0704                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInpCustom '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c "' num2str(seqIdentity) '" -n 4 -M 2000']);
0705                         elseif seqidentity>0.5
0706                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInpCustom '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c "' num2str(seqIdentity) '" -n 3 -M 2000']);
0707                         elseif seqidentity>0.4
0708                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInpCustom '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c "' num2str(seqIdentity) '" -n 2 -M 2000']);
0709                         else
0710                             EM='The provided seqIdentity must be between 0 and 1\n';
0711                             dispEM(EM);
0712                         end 
0713                         if status~=0
0714                             EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0715                             dispEM(EM);
0716                         end
0717                         %Remove the old tempfile
0718                         if exist(cdhitInpCustom, 'file')
0719                             delete([cdhitInpCustom '*']);
0720                         end
0721                     else
0722                         %This means that CD-HIT should be skipped since
0723                         %seqIdentity is equal to -1
0724                         tmpFile=tempname;
0725                         fastawrite(tmpFile,fastaStruct);
0726                     end
0727                 else
0728                     %CD-HIT is not available in Windows so we just
0729                     %export multifasta file into temporary file
0730                     tmpFile=tempname;
0731                     fastawrite(tmpFile,fastaStruct);
0732                 end
0733                 %Do the alignment for this file
0734                 if ~ispc
0735                     [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','mafft-7.305',['mafft' binEnd]) '" --auto --anysymbol --thread "' num2str(cores) '" "' tmpFile '" > "' fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']) '"']);
0736                 else
0737                     [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','mafft-7.305','mafft.bat') '" --auto --anysymbol --thread "' num2str(cores) '" "' tmpFile '" > "' fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']) '"']);
0738                 end
0739                 if status~=0
0740                     %It could be that alignment failed because only one
0741                     %sequence was left after clustering. If that is the
0742                     %case, then the clustered file is just copied as 'faw'
0743                     %file
0744                     if any(regexp(output,'Only 1 sequence found'))
0745                         movefile(tmpFile,fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),'f');
0746                     else
0747                         EM=['Error when performing alignment of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0748                         dispEM(EM);
0749                     end
0750                 end
0751                 %Remove the old tempfile
0752                 if exist(tmpFile, 'file')
0753                     delete([tmpFile '*']);
0754                 end
0755             else
0756                 %If there is only one sequence then it's not possible to do
0757                 %a multiple alignment. Just print the sequence instead. An
0758                 %empty file was written previously so that doesn't have to
0759                 %be dealt with
0760                 if numel(fastaStruct)==1
0761                     fastawrite(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),fastaStruct);
0762                 end
0763             end
0764             %Move the temporary file to the real one
0765             movefile(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']),'f');
0766         end
0767     end
0768 end
0769 
0770 if ~ispc
0771     if seqIdentity~=-1
0772         fprintf('Completed clustering and multiple alignment of sequences\n');
0773     else
0774         fprintf('Completed multiple alignment of sequences. Protein clustering was not requested or incorrect seqIdentity value was used\n');
0775     end
0776 else
0777     if seqIdentity~=-1
0778         fprintf('Protein clustering was skipped, since CD-HIT is not compatible with Windows');
0779     end
0780     fprintf('Completed multiple alignment of sequences\n');
0781 end
0782 
0783 %Check if training of Hidden Markov models should be performed
0784 missingHMMs=setdiff(KOModel.rxns,[hmmFiles;outFiles]);
0785 if ~isempty(missingHMMs)
0786     missingHMMs=missingHMMs(randperm(RandStream.create('mrg32k3a','Seed',cputime()),numel(missingHMMs)));
0787     
0788     %Train models for all missing KOs
0789     for i=1:numel(missingHMMs)
0790         %This is checked here because it could be that it is created by a
0791         %parallel process
0792         if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmm']),'file') && ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmw']),'file')
0793             %Check that the aligned FASTA file exists. It could be that it
0794             %is still being worked on by some other instance of the program
0795             %(the .faw file should then exist). This should not happen on a
0796             %single computer. It doesn't throw an error, because it should
0797             %finalize the ones it can
0798             if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingHMMs{i} '.fa']),'file')
0799                 EM=['The aligned FASTA file for ' missingHMMs{i} ' does not exist'];
0800                 dispEM(EM,false);
0801                 continue;
0802             end
0803             
0804             %If the multi-FASTA file is empty then save an empty aligned
0805             %file and continue
0806             s=dir(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingHMMs{i} '.fa']));
0807             if s.bytes<=0
0808                 fid=fopen(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmm']),'w');
0809                 fclose(fid);
0810                 continue;
0811             end
0812             %Create a temporary file to indicate that it is working on the
0813             %KO. This is because hmmbuild cannot overwrite existing files
0814             fid=fopen(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmw']),'w');
0815             fclose(fid);
0816             
0817             %Create HMM
0818             [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','hmmer-3.1b2',['hmmbuild' binEnd]) '" --cpu "' num2str(cores) '" "' fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmm']) '" "' fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingHMMs{i} '.fa']) '"']);
0819             if status~=0
0820                 EM=['Error when training HMM for ' missingHMMs{i} ':\n' output];
0821                 dispEM(EM);
0822             end
0823             
0824             %Delete the temporary file
0825             delete(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmw']));
0826         end
0827     end
0828 end
0829 fprintf('Completed generation of HMMs\n');
0830 
0831 %Check which new .out files that should be generated Check if training of
0832 %Hidden Markov models should be performed
0833 missingOUT=setdiff(KOModel.rxns,outFiles);
0834 if ~isempty(missingOUT)
0835     missingOUT=missingOUT(randperm(RandStream.create('mrg32k3a','Seed',cputime()),numel(missingOUT)));
0836     for i=1:numel(missingOUT)
0837         %This is checked here because it could be that it is created by a
0838         %parallel process
0839         if ~exist(fullfile(outDir,[missingOUT{i} '.out']),'file')
0840             %Check that the HMM file exists. It should do so since %we are
0841             %saving empty files as well. Print a warning and continue if
0842             %not
0843             if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingOUT{i} '.hmm']),'file')
0844                 EM=['The HMM file for ' missingOUT{i} ' does not exist'];
0845                 dispEM(EM,false);
0846                 continue;
0847             end
0848             
0849             %Save an empty file to prevent several threads working on the
0850             %same file
0851             fid=fopen(fullfile(outDir,[missingOUT{i} '.out']),'w');
0852             fclose(fid);
0853             
0854             %If the HMM file is empty then save an out file and continue
0855             s=dir(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingOUT{i} '.hmm']));
0856             if s.bytes<=0
0857                 continue;
0858             end
0859             
0860             %Check each gene in the input file against this model
0861             [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','hmmer-3.1b2',['hmmsearch' binEnd]) '" --cpu "' num2str(cores) '" "' fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingOUT{i} '.hmm']) '" "' fastaFile '"']);
0862             if status~=0
0863                 EM=['Error when querying HMM for ' missingOUT{i} ':\n' output];
0864                 dispEM(EM);
0865             end
0866             
0867             %Save the output to a file
0868             fid=fopen(fullfile(outDir,[missingOUT{i} '.out']),'w');
0869             fwrite(fid,output);
0870             fclose(fid);
0871         end
0872     end
0873 end
0874 fprintf('Completed matching to HMMs\n');
0875 
0876 %***Begin retrieving the output and putting together the resulting model
0877 
0878 %Retrieve matched genes from the HMMs
0879 koGeneMat=zeros(numel(KOModel.rxns),3000); %Make room for 3000 genes
0880 genes=cell(3000,1);
0881 %Store the best score for a gene in a hash list (since it will be searching
0882 %many times)
0883 hTable = java.util.Hashtable;
0884 
0885 geneCounter=0;
0886 for i=1:numel(KOModel.rxns)
0887     if exist(fullfile(outDir,[KOModel.rxns{i} '.out']), 'file')
0888         fid=fopen(fullfile(outDir,[KOModel.rxns{i} '.out']),'r');
0889         beginMatches=false;
0890         while 1
0891             %Get the next line
0892             tline = fgetl(fid);
0893             
0894             %Abort at end of file
0895             if ~ischar(tline)
0896                 break;
0897             end
0898             
0899             if and(beginMatches,strcmp(tline,'  ------ inclusion threshold ------'))
0900                 break;
0901             end
0902             
0903             if beginMatches==false
0904                 %This is how the listing of matches begins
0905                 if any(strfind(tline,'E-value '))
0906                     %Read one more line that is only padding
0907                     tline = fgetl(fid);
0908                     beginMatches=true;
0909                 end
0910             else
0911                 %If matches should be read
0912                 if ~strcmp(tline,'   [No hits detected that satisfy reporting thresholds]') && ~isempty(tline)
0913                     elements=regexp(tline,' ','split');
0914                     elements=elements(cellfun(@any,elements));
0915                     
0916                     %Check if the match is below the treshhold
0917                     score=str2double(elements{1});
0918                     gene=elements{9};
0919                     if score<=cutOff
0920                         %If the score is exactly 0, change it to a very
0921                         %small value to avoid NaN
0922                         if score==0
0923                             score=10^-250;
0924                         end
0925                         %Check if the gene is added already and, is so, get
0926                         %the best score for it
0927                         I=hTable.get(gene);
0928                         if any(I)
0929                             koGeneMat(i,I)=score;
0930                         else
0931                             geneCounter=geneCounter+1;
0932                             %The gene was not present yet so add it
0933                             hTable.put(gene,geneCounter);
0934                             genes{geneCounter}=gene;
0935                             koGeneMat(i,geneCounter)=score;
0936                         end
0937                     end
0938                 else
0939                     break;
0940                 end
0941             end
0942         end
0943         fclose(fid);
0944     end
0945 end
0946 koGeneMat=koGeneMat(:,1:geneCounter);
0947 
0948 %Remove the genes for each KO that are below minScoreRatioKO.
0949 for i=1:size(koGeneMat,1)
0950     J=find(koGeneMat(i,:));
0951     if any(J)
0952         koGeneMat(i,J(log(koGeneMat(i,J))/log(min(koGeneMat(i,J)))<minScoreRatioKO))=0;
0953     end
0954 end
0955 
0956 %Remove the KOs for each gene that are below minScoreRatioG
0957 for i=1:size(koGeneMat,2)
0958     J=find(koGeneMat(:,i));
0959     if any(J)
0960         koGeneMat(J(log(koGeneMat(J,i))/log(min(koGeneMat(J,i)))<minScoreRatioG),i)=0;
0961     end
0962 end
0963 
0964 %Create the new model
0965 model.genes=genes(1:geneCounter);
0966 model.grRules=cell(numel(model.rxns),1);
0967 model.grRules(:)={''};
0968 model.rxnGeneMat=sparse(numel(model.rxns),numel(model.genes));
0969 
0970 %Loop through the reactions and add the corresponding genes
0971 for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
0972     if isstruct(model.rxnMiriams{i})
0973         %Get all KOs
0974         I=find(strcmpi(model.rxnMiriams{i}.name,'kegg.orthology'));
0975         KOs=model.rxnMiriams{i}.value(I);
0976         %Find the KOs and the corresponding genes
0977         J=ismember(KOModel.rxns,KOs);
0978         [~, K]=find(koGeneMat(J,:));
0979         
0980         if any(K)
0981             model.rxnGeneMat(i,K)=1;
0982             %Also delete KOs for which no genes were found. If no genes at
0983             %all were matched to the reaction it will be deleted later
0984             L=sum(koGeneMat(J,:),2)==0;
0985             model.rxnMiriams{i}.value(I(L))=[];
0986             model.rxnMiriams{i}.name(I(L))=[];
0987         end
0988     end
0989 end
0990 
0991 %Find and delete all reactions without genes. This also removes genes that
0992 %are not used (which could happen because minScoreRatioG and
0993 %minScoreRatioKO). If keepSpontaneous==true, the spontaneous reactions
0994 %without genes are kept in the model. Spontaneous reactions with original
0995 %gene associations are treated in the same way, like the rest of the
0996 %reactions - if gene associations were removed during HMM search, such
0997 %reactions are deleted from the model
0998 if keepSpontaneous==true
0999     %Not the most comprise way to delete reactions without genes, but this
1000     %makes the code easier to understand. Firstly the non-spontaneous
1001     %reactions without genes are removed. After that, the second deletion
1002     %step removes spontaneous reactions, which had gene associations before
1003     %HMM search, but no longer have after it
1004     I=~any(model.rxnGeneMat,2)&~ismember(model.rxns,isSpontaneous);
1005     model=removeReactions(model,I,true,true);
1006     I=~any(model.rxnGeneMat,2)&ismember(model.rxns,spontRxnsWithGenes);
1007     model=removeReactions(model,I,true,true);
1008 else
1009     %Just simply check for any new reactions without genes and remove
1010     %it
1011     I=~any(model.rxnGeneMat,2);
1012     model=removeReactions(model,I,true,true);
1013 end
1014 
1015 %Add the gene associations as 'or'
1016 for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
1017     %Find the involved genes
1018     I=find(model.rxnGeneMat(i,:));
1019     if any(I)
1020         model.grRules{i}=['(' model.genes{I(1)}];
1021         for j=2:numel(I)
1022             model.grRules{i}=[model.grRules{i} ' or ' model.genes{I(j)}];
1023         end
1024         model.grRules{i}=[model.grRules{i} ')'];
1025     end
1026 end
1027 
1028 %Fix grRules and reconstruct rxnGeneMat
1029 [grRules,rxnGeneMat] = standardizeGrRules(model,false); %Give detailed output
1030 model.grRules = grRules;
1031 model.rxnGeneMat = rxnGeneMat;
1032 
1033 %Add the description to the reactions
1034 for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
1035     if ~isempty(model.rxnNotes{i})
1036         model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat('Included by getKEGGModelFromOrganism (using HMMs).',model.rxnNotes(i));
1037         model.rxnNotes(i)=strrep(model.rxnNotes(i),'.','. ');
1038     else
1039         model.rxnNotes(i)={'Included by getKEGGModelFromOrganism (using HMMs)'};
1040     end
1041 end
1042 end
1043 
1044 function files=listFiles(directory)
1045 %Supporter function to list the files in a directory and return them as a
1046 %cell array
1047 temp=dir(directory);
1048 files=cell(numel(temp),1);
1049 for i=1:numel(temp)
1050     files{i}=temp(i,1).name;
1051 end
1052 files=strrep(files,'.fa','');
1053 files=strrep(files,'.hmm','');
1054 files=strrep(files,'.out','');
1055 files=strrep(files,'.faw','');
1056 end
